name: py-spython

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: runtime
variants.description: Container runtime installed by Spack for this package

description: The Python API for working with Singularity containers.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: singularityce
dependencies.description:
Singularity is a container technology focused on building portable
encapsulated environments to support "Mobility of Compute" For older
versions of Singularity (pre 3.0) you should use singularity-legacy,
which has a different install base (Autotools). Needs post-install
chmod/chown steps to enable full functionality. See package definition
or `spack-build-out.txt` build log for details, e.g. tail -15 $(spack
location -i singularityce)/.spack/spack-build-out.txt

dependencies.name: singularity
dependencies.description:
Singularity is a container technology focused on building portable
encapsulated environments to support "Mobility of Compute" For older
versions of Singularity (pre 3.0) you should use singularity-legacy,
which has a different install base (Autotools). Needs post-install
chmod/chown steps to enable full functionality. See package definition
or `spack-build-out.txt` build log for details, e.g. tail -15 $(spack
location -i singularity)/.spack/spack-build-out.txt

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-semver
dependencies.description: A Python module for semantic versioning. Simplifies comparing versions.

dependent_to.name: singularity-hpc
dependent_to.description:
Local filesystem registry for containers (intended for HPC) using Lmod
or Environment Modules. Works for users and admins.
